intro: Neopaulia alaica, commonly known as the Hawaiian palaica, is a flowering plant native to the island of Moloka'i in Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Neopaulia alaica is also known for its historical significance in Hawaiian culture and traditional practices.
